title: PECS - Speech Therapy for Toddlers
description:
PECS (Picture Exchange Communication System) is for speech therapy, it is unique AAC (alternative/augmentative communication system) developed in the USA developed for use with children with speech impediments. It is classified within the principle called speech and skills development and has been used with hundreds of autistic children in the United States and many other countries.

It is a system that does not require complex materials or high teaching methods, and does not contain expensive tools, comprehensive tests, or even costly staff or high parenting training, and is used in various different environments, including home, class and society.

This system was applied with children at the age of 18 months, and over time it was applied with adults, due to the difficulties faced by speech therapists in implementing training programs to communicate with autistic children to develop speech and communication skills in many Over the years, workers took months to try to develop the skill of kinetic / vocal imitation.

Children with autism spectrum disorder are not strongly influenced by social reinforcement, so it had to start communicative exercises with functional actions that engage the child to interact with reward reinforcements.

Speech therapists have tried to teach and train silent children to speak, and this type of training usually begins with trying to teach the child to look at the trainer's face or eyes, and then reward the child for producing many sounds, then the stage of imitating sounds and another studying the child to mix these sounds into words The coach chooses it.

According to this type of education, it will take many weeks to solve the problem of delayed speech in children if it is not many months, and during this long time, the child does not have a useful way to communicate with others to express his basic needs. 

During this long period the children did not have appropriate or reasonable means to express their basic needs, and thus they expressed their needs in a variety of poorly adapted ways, and this exacerbated the children's speech delay, then the trainers in this sign language program stopped themselves as they encountered difficulty with children who did not imitate efficiently And when they tried to apply the picture teaching system, they found that children had excessive hand movements, which they imagined the process of reading the communicative message, and also children did not initiate exchange of communication.

Some language training programs include Alternative programs for communication, such as sign language, for example, but PECS is a system that includes skills that are a prerequisite for teaching this system similar to those related to speech training.

Benefits:

• Speech therapy using PECS technique.
• Making the autistic child easily communicate with the outside world using easy AAC app.
• Improving communication and developing communication skills.
• Treatment of delayed speech in children.
• Useful in pronunciation, articulation, and speech improvement in children.
• It can be used for deaf and dumb people.
• Excellent in speaking sessions for children.
• Increase and raise the degree of communication in children.
• Reducing speech impediments

Advantages:

• Providing more than 1,300 talking cards.
• Ease of use with simple interface.
• Ability to add or modify an existing card.
• Control the text of the card.
• multilingual to help more children.
• Control the way cards are displayed according to the required level.
• Full support for the Arabic language, as it was not available previously.

Speech therapists recommend that parents should use PECS - Speech Therapy for Toddlers app in children's speech sessions, especially teaching speech for late children using PECS, and the application also helps a lot in the process of communication.

title: Category Therapy Lite
description:
Category Therapy Lite gives you a sample of the types of activities available in the full app. Category Therapy is a professional speech therapy app that practices mental organization skills for individuals who have language problems due to stroke, brain injury, or developmental disorders. You’ll see why speech-language pathologists & families “absolutely love this app,” calling it “highly recommended,” “my go-to app for categories,” & “well worth it!” 

BETTER ORGANIZATION MEANS BETTER UNDERSTANDING
When mental organization skills (the ability to group items & name common characteristics) are lost or damaged, it affects our basis for structuring & understanding the world. Category Therapy encourages re-learning categorization skills by providing unlimited therapy using evidence-based exercises on your mobile device. 

IMPROVE CATEGORIZATION SKILLS FROM SIMPLE TO COMPLEX 
Category Therapy features four exercises: 
Find | Classify | Exclude | Add One 
and three levels of difficulty: 
Concrete | Subcategories | Abstract 

Category Therapy helps patients develop categorization skills along a hierarchy from simple to complex. It was designed by a Speech-Language Pathologist as a stroke recovery tool and is perfect for people who have difficulty speaking or finding words. 

MAKE THE MOST OF THERAPY SESSIONS 
Category Therapy fits within a collaborative rehab model, seamlessly linking the clinic to the home, while connecting therapists to families & clients. It’s a useful assessment tool for professionals to gain insight into the cognition & comprehension of non-verbal patients, and the comprehensiveness of the app allows for extended engagement & practice time. Category Therapy is simple & intuitive for both professionals and patients, providing more repetitions & faster improvements. 

DETAILED DESIGN EMPOWERS USERS 
The clean, high-contrast layout uses realistic photos, recorded voice & easy-to-read print. Interactive text & icons enable the user to hear an item, category, or instruction stated aloud. With 700 images in 70 categories, four activities with three levels, & multiple settings, the full app has literally thousands of unique exercises. 

THE FOUNDATION OF ALL TACTUS THERAPY APPS 
We believe that therapy should continue as long as you want to improve. We make apps that let you decide when, where, & how often you want to practice. 
* Use the same tools at home as are used in therapy 
* Adjusts to challenge you as you improve & measure progress 
* Affordable single purchase & no ongoing subscriptions 

We believe that apps should make therapy easier for clinicians. 
* Fast access to high-quality, evidence-based materials 
* Ready-made customizable home programs 
* Detailed summaries in clinical language for fast reporting 
* Designed for collaboration & engagement between therapists, families, & clients

Looking for something different in a speech therapy app? We offer a wide range to choose from. Get the right one for you at https://tactustherapy.com/find
descriptionHTML:
Category Therapy Lite gives you a sample of the types of activities available in the full app. Category Therapy is a professional speech therapy app that practices mental organization skills for individuals who have language problems due to stroke, brain injury, or developmental disorders. You’ll see why speech-language pathologists & families “absolutely love this app,” calling it “highly recommended,” “my go-to app for categories,” & “well worth it!”

BETTER ORGANIZATION MEANS BETTER UNDERSTANDING
When mental organization skills (the ability to group items & name common characteristics) are lost or damaged, it affects our basis for structuring & understanding the world. Category Therapy encourages re-learning categorization skills by providing unlimited therapy using evidence-based exercises on your mobile device.

IMPROVE CATEGORIZATION SKILLS FROM SIMPLE TO COMPLEX
Category Therapy features four exercises:
Find | Classify | Exclude | Add One
and three levels of difficulty:
Concrete | Subcategories | Abstract

Category Therapy helps patients develop categorization skills along a hierarchy from simple to complex. It was designed by a Speech-Language Pathologist as a stroke recovery tool and is perfect for people who have difficulty speaking or finding words.

MAKE THE MOST OF THERAPY SESSIONS
Category Therapy fits within a collaborative rehab model, seamlessly linking the clinic to the home, while connecting therapists to families & clients. It’s a useful assessment tool for professionals to gain insight into the cognition & comprehension of non-verbal patients, and the comprehensiveness of the app allows for extended engagement & practice time. Category Therapy is simple & intuitive for both professionals and patients, providing more repetitions & faster improvements.

DETAILED DESIGN EMPOWERS USERS
The clean, high-contrast layout uses realistic photos, recorded voice & easy-to-read print. Interactive text & icons enable the user to hear an item, category, or instruction stated aloud. title: SLP Assistant
description:
We know that attention and engagement are two of the biggest hurdles to a child's learning.  SLP Assistant is one way to solve this problem!

SLP Assistant is a unique and content-rich app that lets the speech therapist or parent choose the best mix of pre-selected questions with the right game separately to keep kids engaged. Games are independent of the lesson trials, thus freeing & expanding the choice combination possibilities between lesson & game. This app was developed by Speech Language Pathologists for the field clinician, motivated parent, AND the finicky child in mind. 

Features include:
-Select from a growing list of speech & language therapy categories
-Content-rich app, so you can use over-and-over, covering many goals
-You have the option to select/deselect questions to trial the child / client
-Select from a list of simple engaging games to go along with your trials
-If the child is tired of the game, then engage them with another game while doing the same lesson.
-Track performance with % scores, cueing levels, and your own notes
-Monitor session-to-session progress with a cumulative history of scores
-Easily save client activity history to Dropbox and other cloud services

Currently, SLP Assistant 1.0 is a BETA version release. We are always looking for ways to improve the quality selection of content and games for the therapist and client. This version focuses on basic language development & some attention-based activities. There are more games and categories to come!

We hope that you find this app as an effective and convenient tool to add to your therapy toolbox.

Website: http:///www.thinkerapps.info
Thinker Apps LLC, in collaboration with Apple Patch Therapy (www.ApplePatchTherapy.com)

title: Speech Blubs: Language Therapy
description:
Do you need more proof? Check out the featured stories on Speech Blubs in Thrive Magazine, Autism Parenting, Brisbane Kids, Speech Chick Therapy, Beautiful Speech Life, and The Speech Teacher. Speech Blubs was also honored by winning the Social Impact award and is supported by Facebook’s Start Program.

This voice-controlled speech therapy app is designed to help kids learn new sounds and words, and to practice speaking in a stimulating, educational environment. We are proud, though a bit flabbergasted that our 1500+ activities have been used over 1,000,000 times to trigger sound and word production in toddlers, late talkers (speech delay), children with Apraxia of Speech, Autism, Down Syndrome, ADHD, and Sensory Processing Disorder.


WHY SHOULD YOU TRUST SPEECH BLUBS?

Jennifer Marron, B.S., SLP-A
I use Speech Blubs with my articulation students who have a difficult time using their lips and tongue to produce certain sounds (e.g. /b/, /p/, /th/, /l/, etc.). The clients I have used this to have so far loved it and are fully engaged. Thank you for a great application!

If that doesn’t give you confidence, you should also know that Speech Blubs
- Uses scientifically proven video modeling for effective speech development
- Has over 1500+ exercises, activities, funny hats, videos, mini-games, and more!
- Releases brand new, exciting content every week!
- Uses 25 fun activity themes – Early Sounds, When I Grow Up, Get into Shapes, Living Colors, This Is My Body, Mouth Gym, Animal Kingdom, Ride Your Wheels, Sing Along, Guess the Word, Guess the Sound, NUMB3R5, and many more!
- Has voice-activated functionality that provides a fun, interactive learning experience
- Makes fun use of special effects like funny hats and masks in real time using facial detection
- Lets you collect stickers and fill your sticker book as your child progresses
- Provides funny and educational content designed to trigger conversation

Try Speech Blubs activities for FREE!

SCIENTIFICALLY-PROVEN LEARNING TECHNIQUES
In a recent study published by the American Speech-Language-Hearing Association (ASHA), UCLA researchers proved that watching peers in real time results in MIRROR NEURONS being activated, which has been shown to be highly effective in speech development. Speech Blubs uses video modeling to create an immersive learning environment that allows children to observe their peers on video as they learn. 

NEW, REGULARLY RELEASED CONTENT!
Finally, a rare app that parents won’t mind their kids becoming absorbed in, one that provides a nearly endless supply of content for your children to enjoy, including over 1500 activities, exercises, funny hats and masks, effects, videos, mini-games, and more! Our team is always working hard to add exciting new content each and every week!

SUBSCRIPTION, PRICING & TERMS
Start with a 7-day free trial, get access to unlocked content and test out the app. To subscribe (and keep access to all the practices), you will be charged your monthly or annual subscription fee through your GooglePlay account. A recurring transaction, that will automatically renew unless you cancel your account at least 24 hours before the end of the current subscription month. You can manage your subscription, cancel anytime, or turn off auto-renewal by accessing your GooglePlay account. Any unused portion of a free trial period will be forfeited when you subscribe.

Read our full Terms & Conditions and Privacy Policy here: https://speechblubs.com/legal/privacy-policy-for-applications/

comments: We've been trying for a while, but my 2.5 year old is not interested in trying to repeat the words. I'll likely cancel after the first year. Suggestion for the app developers: In the activities where the kids are teaching a new word, you should add a picture of the item in the corner of the screen while the kids say it. Otherwise they hear the word pronunciation over and over without getting the association to the meaning. EDIT: Yes, we sit with him using it and try to make it fun for him.

Kept seeing ads for this, so I downloaded it! Started the free trial before I decided to buy a subscription, and so glad I did! I couldn't even get a single activity done. There was no sound, the screen kept freezing and the app keeps force closing. Waste of time.

If I could give it a zero I really would as I should've read the reviews first before purchasing. This App is an absolute disaster, waste of time energy and money. I paid for the free trial and the available activities for my 24 month old son to use are so limited with only one activity in each section. I am trying to cancel subscription after ten mins of use its proving to be a headache and not that simple. Can someone pls advise and instruct me on how to cancel subscription ASAP pls. Thanks

On android you do have child lock like you do on iOS, also when it comes to pressing the buttons on the screen the entire screen is active so of my son holds the device with his left thumb on the screen he can't complete the actions like skip forward it take a photo as it doesn't use multi touch. Such a shame that they add these to iOS but not Android.
My 3 year old lost interest quick. Only part she liked was the photo filters.

title: Mindfulness-Based Speech Therapy for Stuttering
description:
Buddo is a 90-day mindfulness meditation course for people who stutter. Manage your fear and anxiety caused by stuttering through our mediation exercises. 

Unlike traditional speech therapy, the course helps you achieve greater fluency with mindfulness and relaxation techniques.

This course was designed by people who used to stutter but were able to become stutter-free thanks to the mindfulness meditation practice. The emerging research on mindfulness and its effects on stuttering suggests that this ancient technique can have profound benefits on how a person who stutters perceives himself/herself. Regular mindfulness practice helps lower levels of stress and anxiety caused by stuttering, improves self esteem, and in many cases helps people to control their stuttering. 

The 90-day course consists of 9 parts, 10 sessions each. We recommend that you complete one session each day. Preferably in the morning but any other time of the day is fine too. What's important is to practice regularly. This course can be repeated many times. In fact, we recommend that you repeat the course at least 3 times to get more benefit out of it. 

What will you get from the course:

Speak with more confidence
Reduce stuttering
Learn to remain calm
Reduce speech anxiety
Increase mindfulness
Become a happier human

You can try this meditation course risk-free with a free trial. If you have any questions, feel free to email us app@buddo.io

title: e-orthophoniste.com
description:
e-orthophoniste.com® est un puissant outil d'aide à la rééducation orthophonique. Conçu pour faciliter le travail des praticiens, il enrichit la prise en charge et le suivi des patients. Les exercices ludiques et personnalisables qu'il contient, sont utilisables tant en séance qu'à distance sur tous supports digitaux : ordinateurs, tablettes (recommandées) et smartphones.
 
Simple d'utilisation et convivial, e-orthophoniste.com® a été pensé par des orthophonistes pour des orthophonistes pour vous simplifier la vie et procurer à vos patients une expérience unique et motivante.

Pour utiliser l'application il est nécessaire de créer un compte gratuitement sur le site www.e-orthophoniste.com

Principales fonctionnalités :

Un réservoir inépuisable d'exercices
- 200 exercices préconfigurés 
- 23 modèles d’exercices, validés par notre équipe scientifique.
- Des centaines de milliers de configurations possibles.
- 5 programmes de remédiation : langage oral, langage écrit, fonctions exécutives, logico-maths et mémoire.

Une solution moderne et séduisante pour vous faciliter le travail 
- Entièrement personnalisable, la solution est très facile d’accès.
- Fiches détaillées élaborées par notre équipe scientifique pour tous les modèles d’exercices.
- Possibilité de lancer instantanément des exercices, de préparer des séances ou des prescriptions en quelques clics.
- Suivi automatique et en temps réel des résultats des exercices.
- Accès sécurisé permettant à vos patients d’effectuer vos prescriptions à domicile si vous le décidez.

title: Logopedia 3 : ejercicios de articulación, español
description:
www.logopedia-ejercicios.es 
YouTube video
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCr1FOmQfQNGw1pMwAOGNICg 

Esta aplicación está diseñada para todos los niños y adultos que tienen dificultades en la articulación de algunos fonemas. Además de acudir a logopedia, está aplicación supone un apoyo importante, para realizar en casa, con imágenes y juegos divertidos. Esto fomenta la generalización de los fonemas en el habla, y por tanto una evolución más rápida y efectiva.

La aplicación está diseñada tanto niños como para adultos, que necesiten y quieran mejorar su articulación, y también pueden trabajar ejercicios de atención y memoria al mismo tiempo.

La aplicación de logopedia contiene 18 sonidos, pero también se han añadido los sonidos compuestos, de forma que se pueden trabajar un total de 29 sonidos diferentes (B, BL, BR, CL,CR, D,F,FL,FR, G, GL,GR,CH, J, K, L, LL, M, N, P, PL,PR,R, RR, S, T, TR,DR,Z ).

La aplicación contiene un gran número de imágenes variadas y seleccionadas para trabajar con diversión todos los fonemas. Es importante que en casa los papás y mamás puedan acompañar el trabajo con esta aplicación, y así afianzar el trabajo realizado con la logopeda.

Esta aplicación está diseñada para acompañar el trabajo de las sesiones de logopedia. Así el terapeuta tiene un apoyo de imágenes de todos los fonemas además de juegos que hacen el trabajo más atractivo para los niños.

La aplicación ha sido elaborada con la colaboración de la logopeda Beatriz Ibarra Benedicto .

Logopedia 1 : ejercicios de articulación
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.pmqsoftware.logopedia.es1    
– Contiene: 13 sonidos ( B,BL,BR,CL,CR,D,F,FL,FR,G,GL,GR,CH )
– 478 palabras, 478 oraciones
– El precio de todos los sonidos es de 4.99 EUR.

Logopedia 2 : ejercicios de articulación
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.pmqsoftware.logopedia.es2 
– Contiene: 7 sonidos ( J, K, L, LL, M, N,  P)
– 483 palabras, 572 oraciones
– El precio de todos los sonidos es de 4.99 EUR.

Logopedia 3 : ejercicios de articulación
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.pmqsoftware.logopedia.es3 
– Contiene: 9 sonidos ( PL,PR,R, RR, S, T, TR,DR,Z)
– 429 palabras, 640 oraciones
– El precio de todos los sonidos es de 4.99 EUR.

Estos ejercicios no reemplazan las sesiones de logopedia. El uso de la aplicación ayuda a practicar en casa, de forma entretenida y motivadora. Es importante que haya un miembro de la familia mientras los niños están con la aplicación.
Antes de empezar con los ejercicios de esta aplicación el niño debe ser capaz de decir el sonido solo y también decirlo en sílabas simples. Los ejercicios y juegos de esta aplicación ayudan a la articulación en palabras más complejas.
Si no estás seguro de lo que hacer, consulta con un logopeda.

– Contiene: 9 sonidos ( PL,PR,R, RR, S, T, TR,DR,Z)
– 429 palabras, 640 oraciones
– El precio de todos los sonidos es de 4.99 EUR.

Estos ejercicios no reemplazan las sesiones de logopedia. El uso de la aplicación ayuda a practicar en casa, de forma entretenida y motivadora. Es importante que haya un miembro de la familia mientras los niños están con la aplicación.
Antes de empezar con los ejercicios de esta aplicación el niño debe ser capaz de decir el sonido solo y también decirlo en sílabas simples. Los ejercicios y juegos de esta aplicación ayudan a la articulación en palabras más complejas.
Si no estás seguro de lo que hacer, consulta con un logopeda.

title: Speech Therapy Flashcards - S
description:
Simple design and easy to use!  Large and engaging images for the /s/ sound in words. The flashcards are also useful for language learning and English as a Second Language practice (ESL).

Each card includes a large image, printed word, and audio recording.  Press the image to hear the word. Swipe to go to the next card.

The app includes:

20 images with /s/ in the beginning of the word
20 images with /s/ in the middle of the word
20 images with /s/ in the end of the word
20 Challenge words (/s/ blends)

For interactivity, see our Speech SoundPractice for S app for $.99

title: AAC Essentials
description:
AAC Essentials is an easy to use Augmentative & Alternative Communication (AAC) app which provides help to people who can’t speak or have a problem being understood. It's an easy to use App as with just a few taps you can structure whole sentences, or type in your own words to form your own sentences. With AAC Essentials you are just few taps away from communicating with the world.

AAC Essentials's cool features and a helpful layout make navigating and using the app simple and easy.

KEY FEATURES:

1.	AAC Essentials, a symbol based app allows people to express themselves.

2.	Simple and easy to use intuitive interface allows people to communicate easily and comprehensively.

3.	AAC Essentials is created for the purpose of providing assistance to people struggling with speech fluency.

4.	The app’s versatility makes it useful for non-verbal people with autism, cerebral palsy, Down syndrome, and a range of other diagnoses or speech impediments like apraxia and dysarthria.

title: Avaz AAC
description:
Avaz AAC is an augmentative and alternative communication app that empowers children & adults having speech-related disabilities with a voice of their own. A fully-featured speech app that also includes a training module for new AAC users & caregivers.

The research-based pragmatic vocabulary consists of over 15,000 pictures (Symbolstix) with a variety of high-quality voices that a communicator regardless of their ability can tap to form sentences quickly. With a wide range of personalization & customization options, you can make Avaz AAC your own in just a matter of minutes.

Core words as we know make up for 80% of what we speak during our typical day. These core words are laid out in an order that is based on extensive years of research. This allows users to grow steadily from using 1-2 word phrases to full sentences using Avaz AAC.


+ Picture mode
- 3 levels of vocabulary laid out in a consistent pattern to ensure quick access and motor memory that grows with the communicator.
- Color-coded words with Fitzgerald key allows quick correlation of part of speech with other special ed classroom materials.
- Zooming in and out of words to reassure the communicator of the selection made (visual reinforcement).
- For more advanced users of AAC, choose not to show the pictures in the message box and also change the number of pictures displayed (from 1-77).
- Add and personalize multiple words and folders in a matter of seconds.
- Quickly search for words and see their path.

+ Keyboard mode
- Create sentences with just a few taps with a powerful prediction system.
- Have spell check for words that are commonly misspelled.
- Assign an entire sentence to a letter on the keyboard to quickly load them.
- Quickly speak out sentences by adding them to the quick bar.

+ Dashboard
- Track the communicator’s progress over time with the help of rich, easy to understand graphs and charts.
- Create more conversation opportunities into the communicator’s life through an activity-based dashboard. You will get conversation ideas, strategies, and modeling training for the most frequent activities of daily living.
- Resources: Access 100s of tips and research-based papers related to AAC & AT.

+ Other key features
- Available in 4 foreign languages - English US, English AU, French, Sinhala.
- Available in 6 Indian regional languages - Hindi, Tamil, Malayalam, Kannada, Marathi, Telugu.
- Quickly backup and restore the vocabulary across several devices via Dropbox.
- Share a folder with other Avaz AAC users.
- Seek the attention of the caregiver with the ‘mistake’ & ‘alert’ button.
- Create a PECS book by creating a PDF file in the app and printing it onto a binder.
- Access to FAQs and support desk in the app.
- Add a passcode to settings & edit mode.


You can try Avaz AAC for 14 days with access to pictures and voices before deciding to purchase it. After that, you can choose to subscribe to a monthly, annual or lifetime plan - whichever suits your pocket the best :)

We are always happy to hear from you. For any questions, support or general, please feel free to write to us at support@avazapp.com

The customer service has been fantastic i cant say enough good things about them every time I have emailed i get a response from them the next day. We love this app i am recommending it to everyone i know.

I would recommend Avaz to anyone who is in need to communicate in an alternative way other than speech or sign language, be it for children and adults alike. Thankyou.

title: 9zest Stroke Recovery
description:
9zest Stroke Rehab aims to enhance the quality of life by providing easy, affordable, and at-home solution for stroke recovery. The exercises are designed by certified therapists and help in activities of daily living such as eating, drinking, walking, driving, brushing teeth, picking a pen, wearing a shirt, etc, reducing stroke challenges. 

The therapy program is also designed to minimize the chances of stroke recurrence and help in stroke prevention.

9zest Stroke Rehab offers a combination of Physical Therapy, Speech Therapy, Occupational Therapy and Yoga to fight stroke symptoms, leveraging Neuroplasticity principles. 
 
 9zest, being a tele-therapy solution not only saves on time but also gives the user a premium therapy at a fixed cost. A user can workout from Smartphones (iPhone, Android), Tablets, iPad and Desktop/Laptop/Personal Computer using Google Chrome browser. 

The app prescribed, coach-assisted, and easy to follow videos help a user:

Strengthen affected arm or leg
 Improve hand function
Increase walking endurance
Improve balance & reduce falls
Reduce muscle pain/stiffness
Improve sleep 
Reduce stress, anxiety and depression
Enhance speech clarity
Better bladder and bowel control
Improve swallowing and chewing
Reduce drooling     

9zest Stroke Rehab comes handy with features like:

· Easy in-app assessment to create personalized therapy program
· Easy to follow audio & visual workout sessions along with demo video for each exercise
· ‘Progress Meter’ that consists of tests to measure and track the improvements for a chosen goal
· 'Anytime, anywhere' exercises that can be customized on the basis of variations and intensity
· Coach Connect that lets you connect to a certified therapist for hassle-free onboarding
· Smart TV compatible audios and videos

With an aim to provide financial independence to stroke patients, 9zest offers affordable and cost-effective stroke rehabilitation therapy to the users with various benefits that can help them fight stroke-led challenges effectively.

Stroke Rehabilitation at its best:
· 9zest Stroke Rehab designs a personalized physical therapy program for better balance, posture, mobility and walking endurance helping in stroke recovery.
· With Speech Therapy, individuals are able to resolve speech and swallowing issues and improve their existing speech competency.
· Use of Occupational Therapy enables people to perform Activities of Daily Living (ADL) by improving Fine Motor Movements.
· Yoga postures to energize, strengthen and calm the body and hence help to improve sleep and reduce stress and anxiety.

Subscription information:
· 9zest Stroke Rehab offers Monthly and Yearly subscription.
· All users are eligible to avail 7 days free trial post which they will be charged for the monthly or yearly subscription.
A user can also try Basic Plan that lets the user do certain Parkinson’s exercises known to be helpful in managing stroke symptoms.
· 9zest does not store any payment/credit card information on subscription purchase. All in-app purchases are securely handled by Google play store.
· Subscription automatically renews unless Auto-Renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the scheduled date of renewal. One can manage subscription and turn off auto-renewal using Account Settings.


For more information, follow Terms of Use (https://9zest.com/terms-and-conditions-of-use-members) and refer to 9zest Privacy Policy (https://9zest.com/privacy-policy)


About 9zest:
9zest’s mission is to make the world-class therapy available and affordable for anyone dealing with stroke. With the help of certified physical therapists, speech therapists, and yoga coaches, 9zest brings forth an effective solution to cater to those dealing with stroke challenges worldwide. 


References: https://9zest.com/references

title: One-Minute Articulation App
description:
This app makes daily practice easy and simple because it only takes 1-minute to practice 60 or more target sounds! Fast, noticeable results in a child’s speech are seen within weeks!

Research shows that children who use High Frequency, Short Duration practice of target sounds are dismissed from speech therapy more than 8 months sooner than children in traditional programs. This app was created to give parents, teachers and Speech-Language Pathologists a way to tap into High Frequency, Short Duration drills so that every second spent with a child counts! The focus of each round, either in the practice mode or the test mode, is to elicit as many correct responses as possible from a child in the shortest amount of time to establish correct and consistent production of sounds and to change speech patterns.

Parents often report frustration in getting children to practice drills and speech homework at home but with this app it is easy to motivate a child to practice for a minute or two.

- 21 sounds
- 216 Rounds
- Word, Phrase, Sentence Levels
- Practice & Test Mode
- Easy data acquisition
- Works on Speed & Accuracy
- Simple & Easy to Use
- Unlimited profiles available
- PERFECT for Parents to use for Home Practice!
- 60+ practices in 1 minute!

This app allows a child to get right to work.  With short, intense drill practices at the word, phrase and sentence levels children learn to speak and pronounce their sounds in record time. New speech patterns are carried over into everyday life because a child uses speed and accuracy when practicing their target sounds. A must have app if you want to see fast, effective results!

--

One-Minute Articulation offers a $1.99, $3.99 monthly renewing subscription and $28.99 yearly renewing a subscription to unlock Basic and Premium functionality.

The purchase will be charged from your iTunes account if you choose to buy the One-Minute Articulation Basic and One-Minute Articulation Premium subscription. You can manage or cancel your subscription through the user settings in iTunes after the purchase. The subscription period ends with the same kind of subscription you already bought to the same price unless you turn off your subscription 24 hours before it renews. It is not possible to cancel your current subscription during the time your subscription is active. Any unused portion of a free trial period, if offered, will be forfeited when the user purchases a One-Minute Articulation Basic and One-Minute Articulation Premium subscription.

If you don’t choose to purchase One-Minute Articulation Basic and One-Minute Articulation Premium, you can still use One-Minute Articulation for free. Prices are in U.S. dollars, may vary in countries other than the U.S. and are subject to change without notice.

Privacy Policy: http://fmgdenver.com/assets/Privacy-Policy-One-Minute-Articulation-App.pdf

Terms & Condition: http://fmgdenver.com/assets/Terms-And-Conditions-One-Minute-Articulation.pdf

comments: This a great app developed by an amazing speech therapist!! Her methods have worked wonders for my twins and this app is a great supplement for at home/on the go practice. Not to mention the kids get really excited to "do their words" now! My only concern with the app is that test results don't transfer from separate devices for Android users. If there was some sort of log in and out feature for the app, I believe the entries could be saved on any device the app is used on. ☺️

What a rip off, the 'phrases' and 'sentences' are literally the same for each word in the set of sounds. For example, if you do B sentences it will be 'Bob will beg for a big banana', and then 'Bob will beg for a big ball'. Saying the exact same sentence with one word difference is ridiculous. Don't buy.

I signed up for the free trial and couldn't hear any sound. I then subscribed for a paid version even though I still had the free subscription, and still no sound coming out from the app. I sent a mail to you yesterday about this and I haven't gotten a response. It's getting really frustrating!!!!

The One-minute Articulation app is an all in one speech app. It introduces vocabulary, allows the student to practice and test fluency of words and word phrases. As a parent it gives you a clear understanding of where your student is verbally and how to help your student communicate.

A very fast, simple and easy yet effective way to train children to say and practice their sounds correctly. My kid loves to see her results and all the sounds she has done! This is a fabulous way to teach speech to children!

title: Aphasia Speech Therapy
description:
Aphasia is an impairment of language, affecting the production or comprehension of speech and the ability to read or write. Aphasia is always due to injury to the brain-most commonly from a stroke, particularly in older individuals. But brain injuries resulting in aphasia may also arise from head trauma, from brain tumors, or from infections.

Aphasia can be so severe as to make communication with the patient almost impossible, or it can be very mild. It may affect mainly a single aspect of language use, such as the ability to retrieve the names of objects, or the ability to put words together into sentences, or the ability to read. More commonly, however, multiple aspects of communication are impaired, while some channels remain accessible for a limited exchange of information.

It is the job of the professional to determine the amount of function available in each of the channels for the comprehension of language, and to assess the possibility that treatment might enhance the use of the channels that are available.

In this App you can find more information on the different types of aphasia such as Global, Broca’s, Wernicke’s, Primary Progressive, Anomic, and Mixed Non-fluent aphasia.

title: Praxigirl
description:
Praxigirl permet d'inventer soi-même ou de générer aléatoirement toutes sortes sortes de grimaces, à reproduire ensuite au cabinet d'orthophonie ou à la maison, pour travailler la motricité bucco-linguo-faciale dans le cadre des troubles d'articulation, des retards de parole, de la déglutition atypique...

Les lèvres, les joues, la langue, la mandibule, les yeux, les sourcils des personnages peuvent être mobilisés.

On peut aussi facilement générer des séquences animées à reproduire (balayage des lèvres par la langue, par exemple). 

Application mise gratuitement à la disposition des orthophonistes et des parents.

title: Speech Therapy Flashcards - S
description:
Simple design and easy to use!  Large and engaging images for the /s/ sound in words. The flashcards are also useful for language learning and English as a Second Language practice (ESL).

Each card includes a large image, printed word, and audio recording.  Press the image to hear the word. Swipe to go to the next card.

The app includes:

20 images with /s/ in the beginning of the word
20 images with /s/ in the middle of the word
20 images with /s/ in the end of the word
20 Challenge words (/s/ blends)

For interactivity, see our Speech SoundPractice for S app for $.99

title: AAC Essentials
description:
AAC Essentials is an easy to use Augmentative & Alternative Communication (AAC) app which provides help to people who can’t speak or have a problem being understood. It's an easy to use App as with just a few taps you can structure whole sentences, or type in your own words to form your own sentences. With AAC Essentials you are just few taps away from communicating with the world.

AAC Essentials's cool features and a helpful layout make navigating and using the app simple and easy.

KEY FEATURES:

1.	AAC Essentials, a symbol based app allows people to express themselves.

2.	Simple and easy to use intuitive interface allows people to communicate easily and comprehensively.

3.	AAC Essentials is created for the purpose of providing assistance to people struggling with speech fluency.

4.	The app’s versatility makes it useful for non-verbal people with autism, cerebral palsy, Down syndrome, and a range of other diagnoses or speech impediments like apraxia and dysarthria.

title: Avaz AAC
description:
Avaz AAC is an augmentative and alternative communication app that empowers children & adults having speech-related disabilities with a voice of their own. A fully-featured speech app that also includes a training module for new AAC users & caregivers.

The research-based pragmatic vocabulary consists of over 15,000 pictures (Symbolstix) with a variety of high-quality voices that a communicator regardless of their ability can tap to form sentences quickly. With a wide range of personalization & customization options, you can make Avaz AAC your own in just a matter of minutes.

Core words as we know make up for 80% of what we speak during our typical day. These core words are laid out in an order that is based on extensive years of research. This allows users to grow steadily from using 1-2 word phrases to full sentences using Avaz AAC.


+ Picture mode
- 3 levels of vocabulary laid out in a consistent pattern to ensure quick access and motor memory that grows with the communicator.
- Color-coded words with Fitzgerald key allows quick correlation of part of speech with other special ed classroom materials.
- Zooming in and out of words to reassure the communicator of the selection made (visual reinforcement).
- For more advanced users of AAC, choose not to show the pictures in the message box and also change the number of pictures displayed (from 1-77).
- Add and personalize multiple words and folders in a matter of seconds.
- Quickly search for words and see their path.

+ Keyboard mode
- Create sentences with just a few taps with a powerful prediction system.
- Have spell check for words that are commonly misspelled.
- Assign an entire sentence to a letter on the keyboard to quickly load them.
- Quickly speak out sentences by adding them to the quick bar.

+ Dashboard
- Track the communicator’s progress over time with the help of rich, easy to understand graphs and charts.
- Create more conversation opportunities into the communicator’s life through an activity-based dashboard. You will get conversation ideas, strategies, and modeling training for the most frequent activities of daily living.
- Resources: Access 100s of tips and research-based papers related to AAC & AT.

+ Other key features
- Available in 4 foreign languages - English US, English AU, French, Sinhala.
- Available in 6 Indian regional languages - Hindi, Tamil, Malayalam, Kannada, Marathi, Telugu.
- Quickly backup and restore the vocabulary across several devices via Dropbox.
- Share a folder with other Avaz AAC users.
- Seek the attention of the caregiver with the ‘mistake’ & ‘alert’ button.
- Create a PECS book by creating a PDF file in the app and printing it onto a binder.
- Access to FAQs and support desk in the app.
- Add a passcode to settings & edit mode.


You can try Avaz AAC for 14 days with access to pictures and voices before deciding to purchase it. After that, you can choose to subscribe to a monthly, annual or lifetime plan - whichever suits your pocket the best :)

We are always happy to hear from you. For any questions, support or general, please feel free to write to us at support@avazapp.com

comments: I have used a lot of aac apps and this one is hands down the best one. My son loves it and has started to make his own category's in the app its wonderful to see him so engaged. The customer service has been fantastic i cant say enough good things about them every time I have emailed i get a response from them the next day. We love this app i am recommending it to everyone i know.

Avaz has been a vital means of communication for my son who is non verbal. As a parent including words and pictures on the spot by any means, that is, from our own photo gallery, from internet, or a photo taken there and then is also very essential. I would recommend Avaz to anyone who is in need to communicate in an alternative way other than speech or sign language, be it for children and adults alike. Thankyou.

the app is very helpful to my son and the option of uploadin pics and captions helped my son to lwar talking and naes of stuff..alsothe support guys are very good nice and fast replying..thanku avaz team

best aac app I use various aac apps. of the ones developed by parents, this one is the most teacher, and user friendly with more options like that of a more robust big company developed app. when people exclaim the cost of app is high, it actually has the most bang for its buck compared to others on the same level. Avaz offers a subscription plan that others do not. and come aac awareness month keep your eye our for special promotions. the Avaz developers do this for families not self.
installed it and spent some time learning to use it. then clicked subscribe to buy it and the price is $199 usd! are you kidding me? way to take advantage of our disabled children.

title: 9zest Stroke Recovery
description:
9zest Stroke Rehab aims to enhance the quality of life by providing easy, affordable, and at-home solution for stroke recovery. The exercises are designed by certified therapists and help in activities of daily living such as eating, drinking, walking, driving, brushing teeth, picking a pen, wearing a shirt, etc, reducing stroke challenges. 

The therapy program is also designed to minimize the chances of stroke recurrence and help in stroke prevention.

9zest Stroke Rehab offers a combination of Physical Therapy, Speech Therapy, Occupational Therapy and Yoga to fight stroke symptoms, leveraging Neuroplasticity principles. 
 
 9zest, being a tele-therapy solution not only saves on time but also gives the user a premium therapy at a fixed cost. A user can workout from Smartphones (iPhone, Android), Tablets, iPad and Desktop/Laptop/Personal Computer using Google Chrome browser. 

The app prescribed, coach-assisted, and easy to follow videos help a user:

Strengthen affected arm or leg
 Improve hand function
Increase walking endurance
Improve balance & reduce falls
Reduce muscle pain/stiffness
Improve sleep 
Reduce stress, anxiety and depression
Enhance speech clarity
Better bladder and bowel control
Improve swallowing and chewing
Reduce drooling     

9zest Stroke Rehab comes handy with features like:

· Easy in-app assessment to create personalized therapy program
· Easy to follow audio & visual workout sessions along with demo video for each exercise
· ‘Progress Meter’ that consists of tests to measure and track the improvements for a chosen goal
· 'Anytime, anywhere' exercises that can be customized on the basis of variations and intensity
· Coach Connect that lets you connect to a certified therapist for hassle-free onboarding
· Smart TV compatible audios and videos

With an aim to provide financial independence to stroke patients, 9zest offers affordable and cost-effective stroke rehabilitation therapy to the users with various benefits that can help them fight stroke-led challenges effectively.

Stroke Rehabilitation at its best:
· 9zest Stroke Rehab designs a personalized physical therapy program for better balance, posture, mobility and walking endurance helping in stroke recovery.
· With Speech Therapy, individuals are able to resolve speech and swallowing issues and improve their existing speech competency.
· Use of Occupational Therapy enables people to perform Activities of Daily Living (ADL) by improving Fine Motor Movements.
· Yoga postures to energize, strengthen and calm the body and hence help to improve sleep and reduce stress and anxiety.

Subscription information:
· 9zest Stroke Rehab offers Monthly and Yearly subscription.
· All users are eligible to avail 7 days free trial post which they will be charged for the monthly or yearly subscription.
A user can also try Basic Plan that lets the user do certain Parkinson’s exercises known to be helpful in managing stroke symptoms.
· 9zest does not store any payment/credit card information on subscription purchase. All in-app purchases are securely handled by Google play store.
· Subscription automatically renews unless Auto-Renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the scheduled date of renewal. One can manage subscription and turn off auto-renewal using Account Settings.


For more information, follow Terms of Use (https://9zest.com/terms-and-conditions-of-use-members) and refer to 9zest Privacy Policy (https://9zest.com/privacy-policy)


About 9zest:
9zest’s mission is to make the world-class therapy available and affordable for anyone dealing with stroke. With the help of certified physical therapists, speech therapists, and yoga coaches, 9zest brings forth an effective solution to cater to those dealing with stroke challenges worldwide. 


References: https://9zest.com/references

title: Speech Therapy: B
description:
Speech Therapy: B
Does your child have trouble saying B? We can help!

How This App Works:
Speech Therapy: B is a comprehensive app designed by a practicing speech language pathologist. It describes how to say B and then how to teach it to your child. You will learn how to systematically practice B with your child using research proven techniques in the comfort of your own home. All the needed materials are provided as well as game ideas for every level of practice. There is also a bonus section of photo flashcards that you can bring up on your device for a quick practice.

This app is VERY different than any other app on the market made for speech therapy practice at home. 

I was tired of children with articulation needs NOT making progress! I took a good, long look at materials available for parents. While shiny cards and fancy apps look fun, they are NOT what children need. So, I created a not so shiny app that will actually help your child. In order for your child to make progress with articulation goals, he/she needs to be able to say the desired sounds within words and then practice that skill in a functional setting such as home using words he/she actually says! For example, a child may say B correctly in the word "border" while playing a game; however, he/she most likely won't say that word again for weeks or months. Not really functional.....

On the other hand, if a child practices B while playing and saying "ball," carryover of progress is likely to happen!

This articulation app is created with this philosophy in mind. It will take a bit more work for parents, but it will pay off in the end!

What's Included:
~Explanation on how to say B
~Tips on how to teach B to your child
~Cues that speech therapists commonly use
~Word lists
~Picture Flashcards
~Practice ideas at the word, sentence, and conversational level
~Functional games that don't require flashcards
~Online B flashcards in all word positions

What you can expect:
This app is a tutorial which includes explanations, teaching materials, functional games, and flashcards all wrapped up into one app! You can expect to do a bit of learning at first, and then, carving out a few minutes each day to practice with your child. It only takes a few minutes, seriously!

Who should use this app:
~Motivated parents whose children are having difficulty saying B
~Children who are already in speech therapy and need to work on carryover
~Children who have been working on B for a long time and haven't quite mastered it!
~Children who don't qualify for speech services even though they have trouble saying B!
~Speech language pathologists who want word lists, teaching techniques, and flashcards at their fingertips

Who made this app:
This app was created by a practicing speech language pathologist who understands how much practice is needed for articulation (speech) therapy and knows how parents really have all the power to make the biggest difference. However, parents don't always have access to everything they need. Speech therapy can also be expensive and this is frustrating for everyone!! To reach more families, she made this app for a VERY affordable price so everyone can get learning today.

Enjoy!

This app is a supplemental, home program. If you have concerns about your child, we recommend a consultation by a speech language pathologist before beginning any home program.

title: One-Minute Articulation App
description:
This app makes daily practice easy and simple because it only takes 1-minute to practice 60 or more target sounds! Fast, noticeable results in a child’s speech are seen within weeks!

Research shows that children who use High Frequency, Short Duration practice of target sounds are dismissed from speech therapy more than 8 months sooner than children in traditional programs. This app was created to give parents, teachers and Speech-Language Pathologists a way to tap into High Frequency, Short Duration drills so that every second spent with a child counts! The focus of each round, either in the practice mode or the test mode, is to elicit as many correct responses as possible from a child in the shortest amount of time to establish correct and consistent production of sounds and to change speech patterns.

Parents often report frustration in getting children to practice drills and speech homework at home but with this app it is easy to motivate a child to practice for a minute or two.

- 21 sounds
- 216 Rounds
- Word, Phrase, Sentence Levels
- Practice & Test Mode
- Easy data acquisition
- Works on Speed & Accuracy
- Simple & Easy to Use
- Unlimited profiles available
- PERFECT for Parents to use for Home Practice!
- 60+ practices in 1 minute!

This app allows a child to get right to work.  With short, intense drill practices at the word, phrase and sentence levels children learn to speak and pronounce their sounds in record time. New speech patterns are carried over into everyday life because a child uses speed and accuracy when practicing their target sounds. A must have app if you want to see fast, effective results!

--

One-Minute Articulation offers a $1.99, $3.99 monthly renewing subscription and $28.99 yearly renewing a subscription to unlock Basic and Premium functionality.

The purchase will be charged from your iTunes account if you choose to buy the One-Minute Articulation Basic and One-Minute Articulation Premium subscription. You can manage or cancel your subscription through the user settings in iTunes after the purchase. The subscription period ends with the same kind of subscription you already bought to the same price unless you turn off your subscription 24 hours before it renews. It is not possible to cancel your current subscription during the time your subscription is active. Any unused portion of a free trial period, if offered, will be forfeited when the user purchases a One-Minute Articulation Basic and One-Minute Articulation Premium subscription.

If you don’t choose to purchase One-Minute Articulation Basic and One-Minute Articulation Premium, you can still use One-Minute Articulation for free. Prices are in U.S. dollars, may vary in countries other than the U.S. and are subject to change without notice.

Privacy Policy: http://fmgdenver.com/assets/Privacy-Policy-One-Minute-Articulation-App.pdf

Terms & Condition: http://fmgdenver.com/assets/Terms-And-Conditions-One-Minute-Articulation.pdf

If you don’t choose to purchase One-Minute Articulation Basic and One-Minute Articulation Premium, you can still use One-Minute Articulation for free. Prices are in U.S. dollars, may vary in countries other than the U.S. and are subject to change without notice.

recentChanges:
Info Screen with information on how to use this app, suggested guidelines for the practice rounds and speed levels, and tips on how to use this app for fluency and language skills

Subtitle with name of app on every screen
comments: This a great app developed by an amazing speech therapist!! Her methods have worked wonders for my twins and this app is a great supplement for at home/on the go practice. Not to mention the kids get really excited to "do their words" now! My only concern with the app is that test results don't transfer from separate devices for Android users. If there was some sort of log in and out feature for the app, I believe the entries could be saved on any device the app is used on. ☺️

What a rip off, the 'phrases' and 'sentences' are literally the same for each word in the set of sounds. For example, if you do B sentences it will be 'Bob will beg for a big banana', and then 'Bob will beg for a big ball'. Saying the exact same sentence with one word difference is ridiculous. Don't buy.

I signed up for the free trial and couldn't hear any sound. I then subscribed for a paid version even though I still had the free subscription, and still no sound coming out from the app. I sent a mail to you yesterday about this and I haven't gotten a response. It's getting really frustrating!!!!

The One-minute Articulation app is an all in one speech app. It introduces vocabulary, allows the student to practice and test fluency of words and word phrases. As a parent it gives you a clear understanding of where your student is verbally and how to help your student communicate.

A very fast, simple and easy yet effective way to train children to say and practice their sounds correctly. My kid loves to see her results and all the sounds she has done! This is a fabulous way to teach speech to children!

title: Speech Therapy: P
description:
Speech Therapy: P
Does your child have trouble saying P? We can help!

How This App Works:
Speech Therapy: P is a comprehensive app designed by a practicing speech language pathologist. It describes how to say P and then how to teach it to your child. You will learn how to systematically practice P with your child using research proven techniques in the comfort of your own home. All the needed materials are provided as well as game ideas for every level of practice. There is also a bonus section of photo flashcards that you can bring up on your device for a quick practice.

This app is VERY different than any other app on the market made for speech therapy practice at home. 

I was tired of children with articulation needs NOT making progress! I took a good, long look at the materials available for parents. While shiny cards and fancy apps look fun, they are NOT what children need. Articulation practice should be natural, happen throughout the day, and occur with common words that your child frequently says. 

So, I created this not so fancy app to help parents reach their goals! 

In order for your child to make progress with articulation goals, he/she needs to be able to say the desired sounds within words and then practice that skill in a functional setting such as at home using words he/she actually says! For example, a child may say P correctly in the word "pony" while playing a game; however, he/she most likely won't say that word again for weeks or months. Not really functional.....

On the other hand, if a child practices P by saying "pants" while getting dressed, carryover of progress is likely to happen!

This articulation app is created with this philosophy in mind. It will take a bit more work for parents, but it will pay off in the end!

What's Included:
~Explanation on how to say P
~Tips on how to teach P to your child
~Cues that speech therapists commonly use
~Word lists
~Picture Flashcards
~Practice ideas at the word, sentence, and conversational level
~Functional games that don't require flashcards
~Online P flashcards in all word positions

What you can expect:
This app is a tutorial which includes explanations, teaching materials, functional games, and flashcards all wrapped up into one app! You can expect to do a bit of learning at first, and then, carving out a few minutes each day to practice with your child. It only takes a few minutes, seriously!

Who should use this app:
~Motivated parents whose children are having difficulty saying P
~Children who are already in speech therapy and need to work on carryover
~Children who have been working on P for a long time and haven't quite mastered it!
~Children who don't qualify for speech services even though they have trouble saying P!
~Speech language pathologists who want word lists, teaching techniques, and flashcards at their fingertips

Who made this app:
This app was created by a practicing speech language pathologist who understands how much practice is needed for articulation (speech) therapy and knows how parents really have all the power to make the biggest difference. However, parents don't always have access to everything they need. Speech therapy can also be expensive and this is frustrating for everyone!! To reach more families, she made this app for a VERY affordable price so everyone can get learning today.

Enjoy!

This app is a supplemental, home program. If you have concerns about your child, we recommend a consultation by a speech language pathologist before beginning any home program.

title: Aphasia Speech Therapy
description:
Aphasia is an impairment of language, affecting the production or comprehension of speech and the ability to read or write. Aphasia is always due to injury to the brain-most commonly from a stroke, particularly in older individuals. But brain injuries resulting in aphasia may also arise from head trauma, from brain tumors, or from infections.

Aphasia can be so severe as to make communication with the patient almost impossible, or it can be very mild. It may affect mainly a single aspect of language use, such as the ability to retrieve the names of objects, or the ability to put words together into sentences, or the ability to read. More commonly, however, multiple aspects of communication are impaired, while some channels remain accessible for a limited exchange of information.

It is the job of the professional to determine the amount of function available in each of the channels for the comprehension of language, and to assess the possibility that treatment might enhance the use of the channels that are available.

In this App you can find more information on the different types of aphasia such as Global, Broca’s, Wernicke’s, Primary Progressive, Anomic, and Mixed Non-fluent aphasia.

title: Speech Therapy T
description:
Speech Therapy: T
Is your child working on saying T correctly? If 'yes,' we can help!

How This App Works:
Speech Therapy: T is a comprehensive app designed by a practicing, ASHA certified speech language pathologist. This app describes how to say T and then how to teach it to your child. You will learn how to systematically practice T with your child using research proven techniques in the comfort of your own home. All the needed materials are provided as well as game ideas for every level of practice. There is also a bonus section of photo flashcards that you can bring up on your device for a quick practice.

This app is VERY different than any other app on the market made for speech therapy practice at home. 

I was tired of children with articulation needs NOT making progress! I took a good, long look at the materials available for parents. While shiny cards and fancy apps look fun, they are NOT what children need. Articulation practice should be natural, happen throughout the day, and occur with common words that your child frequently says. 

So, I created this not so fancy app to help parents reach their goals! 

In order for your child to make progress with articulation goals, he/she needs to be able to say the desired sounds within words and then practice that skill in a functional setting such as at home using words he/she actually says! For example, a child may say T correctly in the word "taco" while playing a game; however, he/she most likely won't say that word again for weeks or months. Not really functional.....

On the other hand, if a child practices T by saying "teeth" while brushing teeth, carryover of progress is likely to happen!

This articulation app is created with this philosophy in mind. It will take a bit more work for parents, but it will pay off in the end!

What's Included:
~Explanation on how to say T
~Guide on how to teach T to your child
~Cues that speech therapists commonly use
~Word lists
~Picture Flashcards
~Practice ideas at the word, sentence, and conversational level
~Functional games that don't require flashcards
~Online T flashcards in all word positions

What you can expect:
This app is a tutorial which includes explanations, teaching materials, functional games, and flashcards all wrapped up into one app! You can expect to do a bit of learning at first, and then, carving out a few minutes each day to practice with your child. It only takes a few minutes, seriously! It is basically a crash course on how to be a speech therapist in order to teach T to your child!

Who should use this app:
~Motivated parents whose children are having difficulty saying T
~Children who are already in speech therapy and need to work on carryover
~Children who have been working on T for a long time and haven't quite mastered it!
~Children who don't qualify for speech services even though they have trouble saying T!
~Speech language pathologists who want word lists, teaching techniques, and flashcards at their fingertips

Who made this app:
This app was created by a practicing speech language pathologist who understands how much practice is needed for articulation (speech) therapy and knows how parents really have all the power to make the biggest difference. However, parents don't always have access to everything they need. Speech therapy can also be expensive and this is frustrating for everyone!! To reach more families, she made this app for a VERY affordable price so everyone can get learning today.

Enjoy!

This app is a supplemental, home program. If you have concerns about your child, we recommend a consultation by a speech language pathologist before beginning any home program.

title: Praxigirl
description:
Praxigirl permet d'inventer soi-même ou de générer aléatoirement toutes sortes sortes de grimaces, à reproduire ensuite au cabinet d'orthophonie ou à la maison, pour travailler la motricité bucco-linguo-faciale dans le cadre des troubles d'articulation, des retards de parole, de la déglutition atypique...

Les lèvres, les joues, la langue, la mandibule, les yeux, les sourcils des personnages peuvent être mobilisés.

On peut aussi facilement générer des séquences animées à reproduire (balayage des lèvres par la langue, par exemple). 

Application mise gratuitement à la disposition des orthophonistes et des parents.

title: MarLuc (ayuda logopedia)
description:
Este programa gratuito pretende ser un ayuda en el aprendizaje del lenguaje y apoyar la labor del terapeuta y el trabajo en casa. Permite escuchar las palabras a diferentes velocidades para aquellos que tienen problemas para captar los matices de la pronunciación. Diversos estudios indican que esta ralentización permite mejorar la asimilación de las palabras, para luego ir incrementando la velocidad hasta ser capaces de captar correctamente los matices de las palabras a la velocidad normal a las que las pronunciamos. 

( Ver presentación en https://view.genial.ly/58e75a498b5bcf2aa4730c71/interactive-content-marluc )

Utiliza el reconocedor de voz de tu dispositivo móvil para ayudarte a hacer los ejercicios. El reconocedor puede ayudar a practicar palabras o frases completas y detectar en qué palabras puede haber dificultades. 

Puedes ver las opciones en esta  ayuda interactiva  
 

El programa dispone de varias opciones:

- Dispone del sonido real de más de 8.000 palabras para poder practicar la pronunciación (Gracias a Scott Roberts por cederlas de forma desinteresada)

- Estas palabras se pueden escuchar a diferentes velocidades para captar las diferencias del sonido dentro de una palabra. Esto puede ayudar a las personas que por algún motivo tienen problemas para captar los matices a la velocidad normal a la que pronunciamos las palabras.

- Incluye reconocimiento de voz, para comprobar si se pronuncian bien los ejercicios con palabras o frases

- Se puede elegir una palabra o bien practicar por tipo de palabra; alveolares, bilabiales, etc. o elegir el fonema que se desee

- La aplicación permite anotar los resultados al practicar y enviárselos al terapeuta para que esté al tanto de la evolución en casa y planificar la siguiente consulta.

- Permite anotar los resultados en casa y enviarlos por email al terapeuta

- Esta app es totalmente gratuita y sin anuncios

- Orientada a servir de apoyo en tareas de logopedia y foniatría.

(Esta aplicación requiere Wifi o conexión de datos para funcionar.)

El programa dispone de varias opciones:

- Dispone del sonido real de más de 8.000 palabras para poder practicar la pronunciación (Gracias a Scott Roberts por cederlas de forma desinteresada)

- Estas palabras se pueden escuchar a diferentes velocidades para captar las diferencias del sonido dentro de una palabra. Esto puede ayudar a las personas que por algún motivo tienen problemas para captar los matices a la velocidad normal a la que pronunciamos las palabras.

- Incluye reconocimiento de voz, para comprobar si se pronuncian bien los ejercicios con palabras o frases

- Se puede elegir una palabra o bien practicar por tipo de palabra; alveolares, bilabiales, etc. o elegir el fonema que se desee

- La aplicación permite anotar los resultados al practicar y enviárselos al terapeuta para que esté al tanto de la evolución en casa y planificar la siguiente consulta.

- Permite anotar los resultados en casa y enviarlos por email al terapeuta

- Esta app es totalmente gratuita y sin anuncios

- Orientada a servir de apoyo en tareas de logopedia y foniatría.

(Esta aplicación requiere Wifi o conexión de datos para funcionar.)
summary: Application of help in speech therapy.
recentChanges: Ahora puedes practicar y revisar con el reconocedor de voz las frases que quieras o te recomiende tu terapeuta.

title: Speech Therapy: S Lite
description:
This app is fully functional but has been improved and expanded in our new app Speech Therapy: Practice S 

Initial - 10 images with /s/ in the beginning of the word
Medial - 10 images with /s/ in the middle of the word
Final - 10 images with /s/ in the end of the word

Press the speaker icon & say the word. Then select the "check it" button to see if your pronunciation was accurate. When you are ready for the another word, select the "Next" button.

The app uses speech recognition to let you know if your word was accurate so you must be in a semi-quiet environment.

title: Vocalyx
description:
VOCALYX is a powerful, but easy to use, Augmentative and Alternative
Communication (AAC) tool that utilizes pictograms, photos, and text to allow its users,
suffering from various speech difficulties, to easily communicate with those around them and
to make daily progress on their path of speech rehabilitation.
 
VOCALYX can be used for both children and adults who suffer from the loss of
communication or language. It is completely malleable, and it addresses all levels of
memory, knowledge, comprehension, reading, and writing.  From a child stricken with
low-functioning autism, to a senior citizen who has had a stroke and now suffers from
aphasia, to someone who has had a tracheotomy or laryngectomy, to someone suffering
from MS, Cerebral Palsy, Lou Gehrig’s Disease, brain trauma or legions, or to a person with
deafness or muteness who wants a convenient way to communicate with people who don’t
know sign language, VOCALYX can be a life changing tool to those who need it.
 
In short, VOCALYX can compensate for three types of speech problems: vocalization
(for example in the case of throat cancer), language (as is the case for aphasics), and
communication (in the case of autism). The principle is simple: you click on an image (a
photo, pictogram, or text box) within a premade or personalized keyboard, and VOCALYX
says the message for you through the use of voice synthesis, or with the recorded voice
of either the user or someone close to him/her.
 
The parameters are 100% customizable to meet the needs of all our individual users. This
includes: the size and number of buttons displayed, the length of button presses (useful
for people who tremble because of Parkinson’s, Lou Gehrig’s, or MS for example), the
synthetic voice (age, gender, speed), and there are several different forms of visual
communication.
 
There are keyboards made up of pictograms, photos, and prewritten phrases, as well as
ABCD and QWERTY keyboards. When using the pictogram and photo keyboards, you have
the option of either using the images we have already provided and organized, uploading
your own personal images, or searching through photo and pictogram databases, like
ARASAAC, MAKATON, or PECS, and downloading a wide selection of images.
 
An internet connection is not required to use VOCALYX, except during the registration
and the initial set up. It is usable in all situations and any normal place one would go on a
daily basis. Take advantage of the free trial and discover how much this AAC tool can help
you or someone you love!  When the free trial is over, you can buy VOCALYX per number of
clicks, or as a 1-time final purchase.
 
VOCALYX Features Summary List:
— Free trial available!
— Pay by number of clicks or as a 1-time final purchase
— Fully mobile, VOCALYX can be used anywhere
— Adaptable to all needs

— Rehabilitation tool with a speech therapy team
— Adaptable synthetic voice (age, gender, speed of speech)
— Record personalized voice messages
— Use personal photos or choose from photos and pictograms offered through the app
— 1000 pre-programmed messages for helping communication
— 800 images and 1200 pictograms available to meet individual needs
— Create your own messages
— QWERTY keyboard with word predict
— An unlimited number of personalized messages
— Combine the use of photos, pictograms, and phrases to send texts/SMS or emails
— Display settings are customizable (button size, number of images shown on each page)
— Share your exercises with your speech therapist

title: Logopedia 1 : ejercicios de articulación, español
description:
www.logopedia-ejercicios.es 
YouTube video
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCr1FOmQfQNGw1pMwAOGNICg 

Esta aplicación está diseñada para todos los niños y adultos que tienen dificultades en la articulación de algunos fonemas. Además de acudir a logopedia, está aplicación supone un apoyo importante, para realizar en casa, con imágenes y juegos divertidos. Esto fomenta la generalización de los fonemas en el habla, y por tanto una evolución más rápida y efectiva.

La aplicación está diseñada tanto niños como para adultos, que necesiten y quieran mejorar su articulación, y también pueden trabajar ejercicios de atención y memoria al mismo tiempo.

La aplicación de logopedia contiene 18 sonidos, pero también se han añadido los sonidos compuestos, de forma que se pueden trabajar un total de 29 sonidos diferentes (B, BL, BR, CL,CR, D,F,FL,FR, G, GL,GR,CH, J, K, L, LL, M, N, P, PL,PR,R, RR, S, T, TR,DR,Z ).

La aplicación contiene un gran número de imágenes variadas y seleccionadas para trabajar con diversión todos los fonemas. Es importante que en casa los papás y mamás puedan acompañar el trabajo con esta aplicación, y así afianzar el trabajo realizado con la logopeda.

Esta aplicación está diseñada para acompañar el trabajo de las sesiones de logopedia. Así el terapeuta tiene un apoyo de imágenes de todos los fonemas además de juegos que hacen el trabajo más atractivo para los niños.

La aplicación ha sido elaborada con la colaboración de la logopeda Beatriz Ibarra Benedicto .

Logopedia 1 : ejercicios de articulación    
– Contiene: 13 sonidos ( B,BL,BR,CL,CR,D,F,FL,FR,G,GL,GR,CH )
– 478 palabras, 478 oraciones
– El precio de todos los sonidos es de 4,99 EUR.

Logopedia 2 : ejercicios de articulación
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.pmqsoftware.logopedia.es2 
– Contiene: 7 sonidos ( J, K, L, LL, M, N,  P)
– 483 palabras, 572 oraciones
– El precio de todos los sonidos es de 4,99 EUR.

Logopedia 3 : ejercicios de articulación
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.pmqsoftware.logopedia.es3 
– Contiene: 9 sonidos ( PL,PR,R, RR, S, T, TR,DR,Z)
– 429 palabras, 640 oraciones
– El precio de todos los sonidos es de 4,99 EUR.

Estos ejercicios no reemplazan las sesiones de logopedia. El uso de la aplicación ayuda a practicar en casa, de forma entretenida y motivadora. Es importante que haya un miembro de la familia mientras los niños están con la aplicación.
Antes de empezar con los ejercicios de esta aplicación el niño debe ser capaz de decir el sonido solo y también decirlo en sílabas simples. Los ejercicios y juegos de esta aplicación ayudan a la articulación en palabras más complejas.
Si no estás seguro de lo que hacer, consulta con un logopeda.
